AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alpine, Texas: destination of the truck after turning left onto Highway 90
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States/Mexican border: reference point for determining proximity and reasonable suspicion in the context of vehicle stops and smuggling activities, area where sensors were activated to track a truck's movement
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Big Bend National Park: remote area with limited gas stations where visitors typically have a map and know which roads to take, involved in marijuana transportation by a smuggling organization
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marfa Sector Area Operations Center: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass and sector whose Communications notified the agents
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo, Texas: previous work location of Jay Snodgrass
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas: state where smuggling activities are taking place
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Highway 385: highway from which most vehicles would continue straight toward Fort Stockton and Interstate 10, known for alien and narcotics smuggling, had vehicle sensors activated in an area less than 50 miles from the border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mississippi: state of origin for a vehicle's license plate
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Kansas: state of origin for a suspicious vehicle's license plate, associated with a smuggling organization transporting marijuana from the Big Bend area
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marathon, Texas: location where the truck drove through at 20 miles per hour
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 90: road where the truck turned left
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Fort Stockton: destination for most vehicles coming up Highway 385
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate 10: highway toward which most vehicles would continue from Highway 385
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Highway 118: most direct and logical route of travel from Big Bend to Alpine
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that denied Brignoni-Ponce Jacquinot's motion and sentenced him, also reviewed the denial of a motion to suppress
